name: Company Structure Creation
task:
Create a simple company structure in the database with the following elements:
1. Create 3 department nodes with label 'Department' and name property: Engineering, Marketing, and Sales
2. Create 6 employee nodes with label 'Employee' and properties for name, title, and hire_date
3. Create WORKS_IN relationships between employees and their departments
4. Create REPORTS_TO relationships between employees to establish a management hierarchy
5. Verify the structure you've created by running appropriate queries

Use realistic values for employee properties. Make sure at least one employee is a manager with other employees reporting to them.

args.query: MERGE (d:Department {name: 'Engineering'}) RETURN d UNION MERGE (d:Department {name: 'Marketing'}) RETURN d UNION MERGE (d:Department {name: 'Sales'}) RETURN d

MERGE (e1:Employee {name: 'Alice Smith'}) ON CREATE SET e1.title = 'Engineering Manager', e1.hire_date = date('2018-06-15') RETURN e1 UNION MERGE (e2:Employee {name: 'Bob Johnson'}) ON CREATE SET e2.title = 'Software Engineer', e2.hire_date = date('2020-01-20') RETURN e2 UNION MERGE (e3:Employee {name: 'Charlie Brown'}) ON CREATE SET e3.title = 'Marketing Specialist', e3.hire_date = date('2021-03-10') RETURN e3 UNION MERGE (e4:Employee {name: 'David Green'}) ON CREATE SET e4.title = 'Sales Representative', e4.hire_date = date('2019-09-01') RETURN e4 UNION MERGE (e5:Employee {name: 'Eve Davis'}) ON CREATE SET e5.title = 'Data Analyst', e5.hire_date = date('2022-07-25') RETURN e5 UNION MERGE (e6:Employee {name: 'Frank Black'}) ON CREATE SET e6.title = 'Marketing Manager', e6.hire_date = date('2017-11-11') RETURN e6

logs.name: write_cypher
logs.response: {'status': 'error', 'data': 'Neo4j Client Error: {code: Neo.ClientError.Statement.SyntaxError} {message: All sub queries in an UNION must have the same return column names (line 1, column 135 (offset: 134))\n"MERGE (e1:Employee {name: \'Alice Smith\'}) ON CREATE SET e1.title = \'Engineering Manager\', e1.hire_date = date(\'2018-06-15\') RETURN e1 UNION MERGE (e2:Employee {name: \'Bob Johnson\'}) ON CREATE SET e2.title = \'Software Engineer\', e2.hire_date = date(\'2020-01-20\') RETURN e2 UNION MERGE (e3:Employee {name: \'Charlie Brown\'}) ON CREATE SET e3.title = \'Marketing Specialist\', e3.hire_date = date(\'2021-03-10\') RETURN e3 UNION MERGE (e4:Employee {name: \'David Green\'}) ON CREATE SET e4.title = \'Sales Representative\', e4.hire_date = date(\'2019-09-01\') RETURN e4 UNION MERGE (e5:Employee {name: \'Eve Davis\'}) ON CREATE SET e5.title = \'Data Analyst\', e5.hire_date = date(\'2022-07-25\') RETURN e5 UNION MERGE (e6:Employee {name: \'Frank Black\'}) ON CREATE SET e6.title = \'Marketing Manager\', e6.hire_date = date(\'2017-11-11\') RETURN e6"\n                                                                                                                                       ^}'}

args.query:
UNWIND [
    {name: 'Alice Smith', title: 'Engineering Manager', hire_date: date('2018-06-15')},
    {name: 'Bob Johnson', title: 'Software Engineer', hire_date: date('2020-01-20')},
    {name: 'Charlie Brown', title: 'Marketing Specialist', hire_date: date('2021-03-10')},
    {name: 'David Green', title: 'Sales Representative', hire_date: date('2019-09-01')},
    {name: 'Eve Davis', title: 'Data Analyst', hire_date: date('2022-07-25')},
    {name: 'Frank Black', title: 'Marketing Manager', hire_date: date('2017-11-11')}
] AS employeeData
MERGE (e:Employee {name: employeeData.name})
ON CREATE SET e.title = employeeData.title, e.hire_date = employeeData.hire_date
RETURN e.name, e.title, e.hire_date
